CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas L. McKenna, 1317 Sycamore Street, Mt. Washington, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 12, 1958, pg. A1 with question: �Do you think that the Pittsburgh Railways Company is justified in asking an increase in trolley fares?� answer reads: �Definitely not. Personally, I travel about a mile, not even a mile, just one stop.  And this trip costs a full fare.  For this reason alone, I�m against an increase which would raise the fares to 25 cents.  Also an additional reason is that we are receiving poor service.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thomas L. McKenna, wearing dark coat with lapels, dark textured necktie, and hat with band, standing in front of light colored marble wall, left store window displaying female mannequin wearing dark fur wrap, right store window displaying shoes with sign inscribed "Emma Jetticks The Shoes You Love to Live In"
